title: Sri Lanka and Bangladesh reach Asia Cup Super Fours
byline: Sri Lanka beat Afghanistan to qualify for the Asia Cup Super Four stage, eliminating their opponents in the process.

title: Sri Lanka’s third Nano-satellite to be placed in orbit tomorrow
byline: Sri Lanka’s third Nano-satellite will be placed in orbit tomorrow, marking another milestone in the country’s space technology development, the Ministry of Science and Technology said today.

title: Landmark court ruling orders disability-friendly upgrades at railway stations from Vavuniya to Mahawa
byline: The Anuradhapura High Court yesterday has issued a landmark ruling requiring the renovation of railway stations between Vavuniya and Mahawa to ensure accessibility for persons with disabilities. The decision comes after a petition highlighted the failure to comply with accessibility regulations during recent station upgrades.

title: Nabi’s late blitz lifts Afghanistan to 170 after Thushara’s magic
byline: Mohammad Nabi produced a stunning late assault to rescue Afghanistan, smashing 49 runs in the last two overs to power his side to 170. The highlight was a breathtaking 32-run 20th over, showcasing the veteran’s big-hitting prowess at the death.

title: Atletico and Uefa to review ’spit’ footage during Liverpool match
byline: Atletico Madrid will launch an investigation into the mass confrontation that marred their 3-2 Champions League loss at Anfield, with a member of their backroom team appearing to spit into the crowd.

title: Chinese national falls to death in Dehiwala
byline: The Dehiwala Police recovered the body of a Chinese national who is suspected to have fallen from an apartment complex in Dehiwala.

title: Daniel Katz proposed as IMF’s First Deputy Managing Director
byline: Kristalina Georgieva, Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), today proposed the appointment of Daniel Katz as First Deputy Managing Director, effective October 6, 2025.

title: Women Parliamentarians seek UK support to encourage young women’s political participation
byline: The Women Parliamentarians’ Caucus discussed potential pathways for UK support to the Caucus with representatives of the Westminster Foundation for Democracy (WFD) and held discussions regarding intergenerational dialogue for encouraging young women’s political participation with the representatives of the Law and Society Trust (LST).

title: Court orders PNB Director to appear before court over Backhoe Saman’s wife’s case
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama ordered the Director of the Police Narcotics Bureau to personally appear before court on September 25 and present submissions regarding the charges filed under the Poisons, Opium and Dangerous Drugs Ordinance against Shadhika Lakshani, wife of ’Backhoe Saman’.

title: CSE extends bullish streak for third day; ASPI nears 21,000
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange extended its bullish run for the third consecutive session today with the ASPI advancing 189.84 points (+0.91%) to close at 20,965.26, while the S&P SL20 climbed 68.30 points (+1.16%) to settle at 5,971.30. Market activity remained healthy, recording a turnover of LKR 6.86 Bn on a volume of 254.63 Mn shares.

title: Earth tremor recorded off Trincomalee
byline: A minor earth tremor with a magnitude of 3.9 was recorded in the sea area, about 60 kilometres northeast of Trincomalee, at 4.06 p.m. today (18), the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB) said.

title: Four arrested with counterfeit Rs. 5,000 notes
byline: Four suspects were arrested in Habarana, Anuradhapura, and Pihimbiyagollewa with a large stock of counterfeit Rs. 5,000 currency notes, Police said.

title: Two injured in acid attack during police inquiry
byline: Two people were hospitalized following an acid attack that occurred during a police inquiry at the Kalawana Police Station today (18), police said.

title: Tharanga seventh at World Athletics Championships, finishes ahead of defending champion
byline: Sri Lankan javelin thrower Rumesh Tharanga finished seventh in the Men’s Javelin event at the ongoing World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo, Japan.

title: “It’s our time to shine”: Athapaththu
byline: Playing at a World Cup isn’t something you get to do every day, and it is an opportunity that we will not take for granted.

title: Dunith Wellalage’s father passes away during Asia Cup match
byline: Suranga Wellalage, father of Sri Lankan all-rounder Dunith Wellalage, passed away in Colombo after suffering a cardiac arrest. On the same day his father died, Dunith took the field for Sri Lanka in their Asia Cup encounter against Afghanistan.

title: Spa owners want laws to legalize and regulate their business expedited
byline: Spa owners have called for expediting the legalization and regulating of their business so that it would become an official industry in Sri Lanka.

title: Luxury vehicle in Ella accident lacked recording facility in camera system - Agent
byline: The luxury car involved in the recent fatal accident with a bus at Rawanaella on the Ella–Wellawaya Road was not equipped with recording facilities in its security camera system, its agents have confirmed.

title: Estimated Govt. expenditure to go up by a further 3 billion in 2026
byline: The total estimated government expenditure for 2026 has shot up by a further Rs. 3 billion, compared with the current year, according to the Appropriation Bill for 2026.

title: Taliban ban books written by women from Afghan universities
byline: The Taliban government has removed books written by women from the university teaching system in Afghanistan as part of a new ban which has also outlawed the teaching of human rights and sexual harassment.

title: Customs’ forfeiture of Panama-flagged vessel carrying salt challenged before court
byline: A writ petition was filed before the Court of Appeal challenging the decision of the Sri Lanka Customs to forfeit the MV Stella Beauty, a Panama-flagged cargo vessel carrying a consignment of six million kilograms of iodised white granular salt imported from India.

title: Nabi offers condolences to Wellalage after father’s death
byline: Afghanistan all-rounder Mohammad Nabi has extended his heartfelt condolences to Sri Lanka’s Dunith Wellalage following the death of his father, Suranga Wellalage.

title: Local expertise crucial for Kadawatha–Mirigama Expressway project – SLCA
byline: The recently resumed construction of the Kadawatha–Mirigama section of the Central Expressway can be completed more effectively with the active involvement of local engineers, Sri Lanka Construction Association (SLCA) President Susantha Liyanarachchi told the Daily Mirror.

title: Special police unit set up to tackle foreign employment fraud
byline: A special investigation unit comprising police officers was inaugurated yesterday (18) at the head office of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) to investigate and swiftly resolve complaints related to foreign employment. The unit includes 16 police officers, led by a Chief Inspector.

title: US blocks UN call for Gaza ceasefire for sixth time
byline: The US has for the sixth time vetoed a draft resolution at the United Nations Security Council that would have demanded an immediate and permanent ceasefire in Gaza and the release of hostages.

title: Woman dies after allegedly poisoning her three sons
byline: A tragic incident took place in Hapudanduwala, Ududumbara, where a mother reportedly poisoned her three children before consuming poison herself.

title: Shashindra Rajapaksa further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Shashindra Rajapaksa, who is currently in remand custody, was today ordered to be further remanded till September 22 by the Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: Delay in probes into drug regulatory and passport fraud suspicious – MTUA Chairman
byline: Medical Trade Union Alliance (MTUA) Chairman Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa yesterday (18) raised concerns over the delay in investigations into the data fraud at the Drug Regulatory Authority and the alleged irregularities in passport printing tenders, calling the situation “suspicious.”

title: Ali Roshan jailed for 15 years, fined Rs. 20.6 mn over elephant trafficking
byline: A three-judge bench of the High Court today sentenced Niraj Roshan, alias ’Ali Roshan’ to 15 years of rigorous imprisonment and imposed a fine of Rs. 20.6 million, after finding him guilty of unlawfully keeping five elephants without valid permits.

title: CEB trade unions to launch third phase of trade union action from Sunday
byline: The Sri Lanka Electricity Board (CEB) trade unions will commence the third phase of their ongoing trade union action at midnight on Sunday (21), Sri Lanka Electricity Board Technicians’ Association Chairman Kosala Abeysinghe told the Daily Mirror.

title: Taliban ban books written by women from Afghan universities
byline: The Taliban government has removed books written by women from the university teaching system in Afghanistan as part of a new ban which has also outlawed the teaching of human rights and sexual harassment.

title: Court of Appeal orders Jaffna MC to curb air pollution
byline: The Court of Appeal today directed the Jaffna Municipal Council to take necessary measures to reduce air pollution in the municipal area, particularly by refraining from burning garbage.

title: Sri Lanka dips further in latest Global Innovation Index
byline: The World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) released the Global Innovation Index (GII) 2025 with Sri Lanka positioned at the 93rd spot.

title: ’’I’ll be there like a father’’ – Sanath to Dunith
byline: Sri Lanka Cricket coach and former captain Sanath Jayasuriya shared a heartfelt message following the passing of Suranga Wellalage, father of rising cricket star Dunith Wellalage.

title: Inaugural Ceylon Gemlogue to promote Ceylon gems globally
byline: Sri Lanka’s centuries-old gem trade, steeped in heritage yet alive with modern innovation, is about to take the spotlight in a way never seen before. Ceylon Gemlogue 2025, presented by Ceylon Gem Chronicles, and endorsed by key industry Associations, the Ceylon Gem & Jewellery Traders Association (CGJTA)| GemSriLanka and the Lanka Gem Dealers

title: 19 paddy warehouses opened in Polonnaruwa; 4,500 MT purchased
byline: Nineteen paddy warehouses have been opened in the Polonnaruwa district, and 4,500 metric tons of paddy have already been purchased by farmers, Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) Chairman Manjula Pinnalanda told the Daily Mirror.

title: Air Force intelligence officer arrested with Rs. 20 million worth of gold at BIA
byline: The Narcotics Control Unit of Sri Lanka Customs arrested a Sri Lanka Air Force intelligence officer at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) yesterday (18) while he was allegedly attempting to smuggle gold into the country.

title: No forgiveness for corrupt politicians: Minister Ramalingam
byline: Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources, Ramalingam Chandrasekar made a strong statement against corruption, stating that there will be no forgiveness for politicians who have engaged in bribery, fraud and looting of public assets.

title: Suspected gunman in Dan Priyasad shooting arrested
byline: The gunman suspected to be involved in the shooting of activist Dan Priyasad has been arrested along with two other suspects.

title: Sajith request more time to declare assets and liabilities
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa has made a written request from the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) to submit his assets and liabilities in a digital format.
